intro: Hieracium mougeotii proles pogonatum, commonly known as the hairy yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features yellow-orange composite flowers, with a distinctive hairy stem and leaves. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its botanical structure includes alternate leaves and a basal rosette, contributing to its adaptability in various environments.
